projects: [{"title":"Scotiabank: Customer Acquisition & Retention Strategy","start_date":"Apr 2024","end_date":"Apr 2024","description":"Project Scope :This project aimed to analyze Scotiabank customer data using SAS and present the findings at Deloitte's Toronto Office.Project Goals :- Identifying low, medium, and high-converting customers to tailor acquisition strategies with targeted incentives and marketing channels to maximize conversions and grow Scotiabank's customer base using a logistic regression model.- Identify key segments to develop cross-selling strategies with targeted promotions to encourage customers with only one product to acquire additional Scotiabank products utilizing clustering analysis.Project Outcome :- Focusing on customers in Ontario, Alberta, and British Columbia, prioritizing key age groups (25-35, 35-45, 45-55, and 55-65) with personalized levels of marketing for each customer category.- Utilizing email campaigns with e-statement integrations to deliver personalized offers and leverage mobile app notifications to cross-sell to customers holding one product."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Sysco: Market Penetration and Expansion in the Sustainability Industry","start_date":"Jan 2024","end_date":"Mar 2024","description":"Project Scope :This project was for the Systems Thinking class at Ivey, where my team and I work as consultants for Sysco to help them penetrate and expand into the sustainability market through business operations optimization.Project Goals :- Defining what sustainability means and assigning standard metrics for each product category of Sysco.- Revamping and optimizing the value chain of sysco by keeping sustainability at its core.- Helping Sysco to raise awareness about their 'One Planet One Table' initiative.- Aligning the UN SDG goals with Sysco's value proposition and including a new initiative called 'Sysconsulting'.Project Outcome :- More awareness about sustainability from both the supplier and the customer end.- Better product placement and promotion strategy.- Setting a standard for the establishment of the sustainability ecosystem."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"An Empirical Study central bank of Bangladesh, where I analyzed the systematic process of on-site and off-site inspection of different commercial banks and non-bank financial institutions by Bangladesh Bank.Project Goals :- The main purpose of the project was to understand the systematic process of on-site and off-site supervision by Bangladesh Bank- To find the scope of improvements in the process- Scrutinize the financial performance of some banks through CAMELS Rating- To understand the performance of the banking sector of the country firsthand.Project Outcome :- Got to understand the thorough process of banking inspection- Collaborated in preparing a comprehensive inspection report- Recommended steps to improve the efficiency of the supervision process."},{},{},{"title":"Sustainable Business Guideline for Fayetteville, Arkansas","start_date":"Aug 2021","end_date":"Dec 2021","description":"Project Scope :For the Sustainable Business Guideline project, we chose to focus on the Graduate Hotel located in Fayetteville, Arkansas. The main point of focus in the Graduate hotel is its restaurant, Trophy Room, which is a signature food and beverage concept for Graduate Hotels across the country. The purpose of the sustainable business guideline project is to create a basic guideline model to promote sustainability practices for businesses to follow in the city of Fayetteville. This guideline will offer and include ideas, promotions, practices, incentives, and recommendations to persuade businesses, from small local companies to big corporations in Northwest Arkansas. Fayetteville, Arkansas is already known to be a very sustainable city; however, we want to help businesses optimize their ideas and practices of sustainability so the whole community can make a positive impact on the environment.Project Goals :- To encourage the use of recyclable packaging instead of styrofoam- To reduce paper wastage by shifting to e-receipts - To recommend the sourcing of ingredients from the local market- To bring technological innovation in sustainability practicesProject Outcome :Trophy Room already takes advantage of some sustainability practices; however, there is always room for improvement. Throughout this process, we have been able to cooperate and build camaraderie to create a well-fit sustainability business guideline for the Trophy Room restaurant. With our goal in mind and our cooperation with Trophy Room, we expect this business to work on implementing the ideas we have presented to them due to their desire to make a difference in the environment and to make business impactful for them."},{},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Shadow Pandemic","start_date":"Dec 2020","end_date":"Feb 2021","description":"Project Scope :According to a survey by the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics and the United Nations Population Fund, over 70 percent of married women or girls in Bangladesh have faced some form of intimate partner abuse; about half of whom say their partners have physically assaulted them. Since the outbreak of the virus, emerging data from the front lines have shown that violence against women and girls, particularly domestic violence has significantly grown. This is the Shadow Pandemic growing amidst the Covid-19 outbreak and due to a strain on essential health services, domestic violence shelters and helplines globally have reached their capacities.Project Goals :- The main purpose of the campaign was to raise awareness about gender based violence among young people.- Highlight the importance of support groups in victim recovery.- Create a safe space where survivors can share their experiences and find the answers which people are looking for through their engagement.- To educate the masses on domestic violence and make people understand its gravity.- Explain the role of youth to combat Gender Based Violence (GBV) as kids might grow up in a toxic environment and we want to nudge the youth in the right direction.Project Outcome :- We initiated a dialogue on domestic violence and consent among the youth.- Various solutions were also gathered from the participants in the breakout rooms on eradicating this problem from the society.- We tried to educate the young people, the institutions to reach out to people if they need support in combating domestic abuse.- We understood the characteristics and persona of the abuser and their way of manipulation.To know more visit : This will further support Agora Media in developing market strategy that fits into social selling business model across the US market."},{},{},{},{"title":"Level5","start_date":"Apr 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020","description":"Project Scope:We participated in the Techstars Startup Weekend at Sacred Heart University in the US and as a part of the competition we have to launch a start-up of our own within three days.
